justification: The questionnaire battery assessed "depression (Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale; Zung, 1965)".
Generalised anxiety was measured with the "Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-item scale; Spitzer et al., 2006".
Schizotypy was assessed using the "Short Scales for Measuring Schizotypy; Mason et al., 2005".
Impulsivity was measured with the "Barratt Impulsiveness Scale-11; Patton et al., 1995".
Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder symptoms were captured by the "Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory-Revised; Foa et al., 2002".
Social anxiety was assessed with the "Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale; Liebowitz, 1987".
Eating disorders were measured by the "Eating Attitudes Test; Garner et al., 1982".
Apathy was evaluated using the "Apathy Evaluation Scale; Marin et al., 1991".
Alcoholism was measured with the "Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test; Saunders et al., 1993".
A "short IQ evaluation (International Cognitive Ability Resource; Condon & Revelle, 2014)" was included.

measured_by: State-Trait Inventory for Cognitive and Somatic Anxiety (STICSA)
justification: Participants also completed a measure of trait anxiety: "State-Trait Inventory for Cognitive and Somatic Anxiety".
Sensation seeking was assessed with the "Brief Sensation Seeking Scale".

measured_by: Child and Adolescent Disposition Scale – Daringness subscale
justification: The study added the "daringness subscale of the Child and Adolescent Disposition Scale" to capture daringness.
